DataElement.preferredName: Bladder Carcinoma Decipher Cancer Assay Molecular Subtype Classification Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the molecular subtype of bladder carcinoma determined using a Decipher Bladder Assay.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bladder Carcinoma Decipher Cancer Assay Molecular Subtype Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the bladder epithelium.  Approximately 90% of the bladder carcinomas are transitional cell carcinomas.  The remainder are squamous cell carcinomas, adenocarcinomas and small cell neuroendocrine carcinomas._A genomic subtyping tool designed to identify muscle invasive bladder cancer patients who may benefit from neoadjuvant chemotherapy prior to surgery._Relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules._A group forming a type within a larger type._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma arising from the bladder epithelium.  Approximately 90% of the bladder carcinomas are transitional cell carcinomas.  The remainder are squamous cell carcinomas, adenocarcinomas and small cell neuroendocrine carcinomas.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma arising from the bladder epithelium.  Approximately 90% of the bladder carcinomas are transitional cell carcinomas.  The remainder are squamous cell carcinomas, adenocarcinomas and small cell neuroendocrine carcinomas.

Property.preferredName: Decipher Bladder Cancer Assay Molecular Subtype Classification
Property.preferredDefinition: A genomic subtyping tool designed to identify muscle invasive bladder cancer patients who may benefit from neoadjuvant chemotherapy prior to surgery.:Relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.:A group forming a type within a larger type.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

Concepts.definition: A genomic subtyping tool designed to identify muscle invasive bladder cancer patients who may benefit from neoadjuvant chemotherapy prior to surgery.
Relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.
A group forming a type within a larger type.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma involving the basal cells.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma involving the basal cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma involving the basal cells.: A genetic profile indicating low expression of cellular tight junction proteins, including E-cadherin, which is often associated with triple-negative breast cancer and tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes.

Concepts.definition: A carcinoma involving the basal cells.
A genetic profile indicating low expression of cellular tight junction proteins, including E-cadherin, which is often associated with triple-negative breast cancer and tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the lumen of a blood vessel or other tubular structure.: An influx of cells, generally leukocytes, in locations or numbers not normally found, without other features of inflammation.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the lumen of a blood vessel or other tubular structure.
An influx of cells, generally leukocytes, in locations or numbers not normally found, without other features of inflammation.
